title: umap
description: UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) is a manifold learning technique suitable for visualizing high-dimensional data. Besides tending to be faster than tSNE, it optimizes the embedding such that it best reflects the topology of the data, which we represent throughout Scanpy using a neighborhood graph. tSNE, by contrast, optimizes the distribution of nearest-neighbor distances in the embedding such that these best match the distribution of distances in the high-dimensional space. We use the implementation of umap-learn [McInnes18]. For a few comparisons of UMAP with tSNE, see this preprint.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

obsm_output.description: The pre/postfix under which to store the UMAP results

output_compression.description: Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects

min_dist.description: The effective minimum distance between embedded points

spread.description: The effective scale of embedded points

num_components.description: The number of dimensions of the embedding

max_iter.description: The number of iterations (epochs) of the optimization

alpha.description: The initial learning rate for the embedding optimization

gamma.description: Weighting applied to negative samples in low dimensional embedding optimization

negative_sample_rate.description: The number of negative edge/1-simplex samples to use per positive edge/1-simplex sample in optimizing the low dimensional embedding

init_pos.description: How to initialize the low dimensional embedding

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.
